attributes.action: justify his Governments position that the Treaty of Lisbon "...is for this Parliament to determine."
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We, the people, petition and demand that justification be given to your Foreign Secretary’s "Parliamentary statement on Lisbon Treaty" "The British view is for this Parliament to determine." and petition you to justify the following points: In The Labour Party manifesto 2005 it stated "We will put it to the British people in a referendum..." in regards to the European Constitution.  In summary, we the people, demand to know from you, as the Prime Minister of our elected Government, why the Treaty of Lisbon was not put to the British people in a referendum since it is, in reality, simply the European Constitution Treaty broken down into smaller parts ("The new treaty would be based on the first and fourth parts of the Constitution, the rest of the Constitutions changes being achieved through amendments to the Treaty of Rome." ) to aid in the ratification of the TOL and circumventing the vote of the people on an issue that affects our lives in this country and Europe.
